column4: i have some old device that connects to PS/2 port and some closed source win32 app to operate with it. can you tell me any software that can sniff the communication between this device and app?
any ideas?
try it
you can try running the application in a virtual machine, and then using strace to intercept the relevant system calls. i suggest a hefty use of grep here ;-)
aha
virtualization is completely new to me
the system calls will be translated by the VM, but if you're only trying to work out the communcation protocol, it should do
is there really no other way, like "tcpdump" but with PS/2?
ok
well, all the writes are just system calls...
i was looking for some command line tool such as "tcpdump" but which works with ps/2 instead, but i guess there is none :/
strace | grep ;-)
ok cool
i will seek into it
have fun
are you still here?
yes, i am
the problem is that this app is windows stuff
i cant run it on linux
and its has GUI interface and i dont even have X installed
well, you can try running it under wine. or have a go with any number of virtual machines under linux. you will need X installed for the gui though...
